author: Aristotle
quotedesc: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.

author: Aristotle
quotedesc: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.

author: Aristotle
quotedesc: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Aristotle
quotedesc: All persons ought to endeavor to follow what is right, and not what is established.

author: Aristotle
quotedesc: The whole is greater than sum of its parts.

author: Dr BR Ambedkar
quotedesc: I measure the progress of a community by the degree of progress which women have achieved.

author: Dr BR Ambedkar
quotedesc: Life should be great rather than long.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Poverty is the worst form of violence.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Seven Deadly Sins. Wealth without work; Pleasure without conscience; Science without humanity; Knowledge without character; Politics without principle; Commerce without morality; Worship without sacrifice.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: An eye for an eye will only make the whole world blind.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Truth can be stated in a thousand different ways, yet each one can be true

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: That which is selfish is immoral, and that which is unselfish is moral.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Talk to yourself once in a day.. otherwise you may miss meeting an excellent person in this world.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Take risks in your life, If you win, you can lead! If you loose, you can guide!

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Strength is life; Weakness is death.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Take up one idea, make that one idea your life. Think of it, dream of it, Live on that idea let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Learn everything that is good from others, but bring it in, and in your own way adsorb it; do not become others.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: In a conflict between the heart and the brain, follow your heart.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: That man has reached immortality who is disturbed by nothing material.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: If i love myself despite my infinite faults, how can i hate anyone at the glimpse of a few faults!

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: You are the creator of your own destiny

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: We are what our thought have made us; So take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; They travel far.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: If superstitions enters, the brain is gone

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Dare to be free, dare to go as far as your thought leads, and dare to carry that out in your life.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: The fire that warms us can also consume us; it is not the fault of the fire.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quotedesc: Where can we go to find GOD if we cannot see him in ours own hearts and in every living being.

author: Bertrand russell
quotedesc: The fundamental cause of the trouble is that in modern world the stupids are cocksure while the intelligent are full of doubt.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quotedesc: An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quotedesc: He that can have patience can have what he will.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quotedesc: It is the first responsibility of every citizen to question authority.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quotedesc: Instead of cursing the darkness, light a candle.

author: Franklin Roosevelt
quotedesc: The only thing we have to fear is the fear itself.

author: Franklin Roosevelt
quotedesc: The test of our progress is not whether we add more to the abundance of those who have much; it is whether we provide enough for those who have little.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Blind belief in authority is the greatest enemy of truth.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Genius is 1% talent and 99% percent hard work.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Imagination is more important than knowledge.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: I have no special talents. I am only passionately curious.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance, you must keep moving.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: The woman who follows the crowd will usually go no further than the crowd. The woman who walks alone is likely to find herself in places no one has ever been before.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.

author: Einstein
quotedesc: You never fail until you stop trying.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quotedesc: To get rid of enemy one must love him.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quotedesc: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.

author: Leo Tolstoy
quotedesc: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: Impossible is a word to be found only in the dictionary of fools.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: Victory belongs to the most persevering.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: It is the cause, not the death, that makes the martyr.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: There are only two forces that unite men - fear and interest.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quotedesc: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: First they ignore you, then they ridicule you, then they fight you, and then you win.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: In doing something, do it with love or never do it at all.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Happiness is when what you think, what you say and what you do are in harmony.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: The future depends on what you do today.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: To believe in something, and not to live it, is dishonest.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: In a gentle way you can shake the world.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: God has no religion.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: There are people in the world so hungry, that God cannot appear to them except in the form of bread.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: The simplest acts of kindness are by far more powerful than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: Your beliefs become your thoughts; Your thoughts become your words; Your words become your actions; Your actions become your habits; Your habits become your values; Your values become your destiny

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: You can chain me, you can torture me, you can even destroy this body, but you will never imprison my mind

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quotedesc: A man is the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.
